As an AI language model, I do not have the ability to visit historical sites, but I can provide information on the significance of some of the oldest historical sites in terms of cultural, social or religious aspect.

One of the oldest historical sites in the world is the Gobekli Tepe in Turkey, which is believed to be more than 10,000 years old. This archaeological site has important cultural and religious significance since it is regarded as the world's first temple. The site shows that humans had the ability to organize and cooperate in large groups to build monumental structures even before they started farming and settled down.

Another significant historical site is the Pyramids of Giza in Egypt. These ancient pyramids are over 4,500 years old, and they are considered some of the most impressive and mysterious structures in the world. They have cultural and religious significance because they were built as tombs for the pharaohs of Egypt, who were considered god-kings. The pyramids played an important role in Egyptian religion, as they were believed to protect the pharaohs' bodies and guide their souls to the afterlife.

The ancient city of Petra in Jordan is another historical site with cultural and religious significance. Petra was a major trading hub for the Nabatean people, who carved their city into the rock face. The historical site has many tombs and temples, including the famous Treasury, which was carved into the rock and served as a royal tomb. Petra also played an important role in early Christianity since it was the site where the Apostle Paul began his missionary journey.

Overall, historical sites provide invaluable insight into past cultures and religious practices, and they remind us of the importance of preserving our cultural heritage for future generations.
